name: Trimbakeshwar / Tryambakeshwar
meaning: Lord of the Three (Trimurti) / Three-Eyed Lord
epithets: Trimurti Linga - Lingam of the Three Gods
Godavari Janaka - Father of the Godavari

iconography.form_here: The Trimbakeshwar Jyotirlinga is uniquely three-faced, with each face representing Brahma (creator), Vishnu (preserver), and Mahesh/Shiva (destroyer). This Trimurti representation is not found in any other Jyotirlinga. The lingam is small, protected by a silver frame, and sometimes covered by a natural crown (mukuta) formed by water streams.

symbolism.three_faces: The Trimurti in single form represents the unity of cosmic functions—creation, preservation, dissolution are not separate forces but one divine dance
symbolism.water_crown: Natural water streams forming a crown over the lingam symbolize Shiva as the source of all rivers, all life-giving waters
symbolism.godavari_origin: As origin point of the Godavari, this temple represents the place where the formless divine becomes flowing, life-giving river
symbolism.brahmagiri: The mountain behind the temple represents Brahma—even the Creator bows before Mahadeva

special_features.kushavarta_kund: The exact spot where Godavari emerges—considered among the holiest tanks in India
special_features.silver_mask: The Trimurti faces are protected by silver coverings, removed during special darshans
special_features.narayan_nagbali: Special ritual hall for ancestral rites available nowhere else
special_features.ancient_architecture: Nagara-style temple with intricate carvings from Maratha period

mythology.origin_story: The sage Gautama lived on Brahmagiri hill with his wife Ahalya. During a great famine, Gautama's ashram alone had food due to his powers. Jealous sages conspired against him, creating an illusory cow that died when Gautama touched it. Accused of go-hatya (cow-killing), Gautama performed severe penance to Shiva for purification. Pleased, Shiva released the Ganga from his matted locks to flow as Godavari, purifying the land. The sage then requested Shiva to remain forever, and the Lord manifested as the Trimbakeshwar Jyotirlinga.

key_episodes.title: The Conspiracy Against Gautama
key_episodes.story: The other sages, jealous during the famine, used maya to create a false cow. When it died at Gautama's touch, they accused him of the worst sin. Rather than defend himself, Gautama accepted the punishment and began penance—his humility and devotion eventually revealed the truth and brought Godavari to earth.

key_episodes.title: Ganga Becomes Godavari
key_episodes.story: When Shiva released Ganga from his locks at Trimbakeshwar, she took the name 'Godavari' meaning 'giver of salvation.' Unlike her northern flow as Ganga, here she flows south toward Dakshina—carrying Shiva's blessing to the southern lands.

key_episodes.title: The Trimurti Revelation
key_episodes.story: The three-faced form was not always visible. After centuries of worship, a great sage's intense tapas 'awakened' the Trimurti within the lingam. The priests say this represents a deeper truth—all Jyotirlingas contain the Trimurti, but only here has that inner form been revealed.

primary_mantra.translation: We worship the Three-Eyed One who is fragrant and nourishes all beings
primary_mantra.meaning: The Mahamrityunjaya Mantra—the great death-conquering mantra—originates here

additional_mantras.name: Complete Mahamrityunjaya
additional_mantras.sanskrit: ॐ त्र्यंबकं यजामहे सुगंधिं पुष्टिवर्धनम् उर्वारुकमिव बंधनान्मृत्योर्मुक्षीय माऽमृतात्
additional_mantras.benefit: Conquering fear of death, healing, longevity

festivals.name: Simhastha Kumbh Mela
festivals.significance: Millions gather for holy dip; once-in-a-lifetime experience

philosophy.core_teaching: Trimbakeshwar reveals that the cosmic forces we perceive as separate—creation, preservation, destruction—are unified in one divine reality. The Trimurti lingam visually teaches non-duality: Brahma, Vishnu, and Shiva are not three gods but three faces of one Absolute.
philosophy.death_transcendence: This is the home of the Mahamrityunjaya Mantra—the death-conquering prayer. Trimbakeshwar teaches that death is not an end but a transformation. Those who realize the Trimurti's unity see past the illusion of individual mortality.
philosophy.source_symbolism: As the Godavari's source, Trimbakeshwar reminds us that mighty rivers begin from single points. Great traditions emerge from focused origins. Your own spiritual journey, focused here, can become a river of blessing flowing through your life.
